content: The one feature I need is the actual battery percentage.   I‚Äôd like to know if I have 18% or 2% left.   Bars are inadequate.   I‚Äôm highly disappointed as this is a safety issue
author: kdspeight

content: I‚Äôve used the app on and off for the last six months and usually within the first five minutes of the ride exits out and multiple meters stop wording working whether it‚Äôs cadence or speed or distance traveled. I‚Äôve unloaded it loaded it doesn‚Äôt change. This thing is horrible.
author: Fended ski

content: I use it as my primary‚Äîwhile I ride‚Äîbike computer, and it‚Äôs works really well for that on a Shimano 11 speed rim brake Di2. I come from using Shimano‚Äôs Flight Deck bike computer (when mechanical) and this is the natural progression from that.  Highly customizable, rudimentary d-fly switch control, perfect for on the fly computing.  Not quite stable enough to solely be relied upon to track your rides if you don‚Äôt want to lose a ride every now and then, but hey, it‚Äôs on my phone, so I run Cyclemeter in the background for that.  I love that it‚Äîlike Flight Deck‚Äîdisplays what chain ring and cassette gear I‚Äôm in (if you tell it to).  I also love that it displays my sensor battery status (Wahoo speed and cadence, Watch HR, and my Di2 battery status).  Other than providing a nice picture at the end for the record of the ride, its map function is completely useless.  But hey, it‚Äôs on my phone, I‚Äôve got Google Maps for that.  I bought an iPhone 13 mini to use with it because that‚Äôs the smallest and lightest iPhone with a decent battery life.  Quadloc mount. With a new battery in the 13 mini it can easily go 6 hours without worrying about battery life‚Äîand that‚Äôs streaming Bluetooth to my AirPod pro‚Äôs, running gps on at least two apps constantly, with the screen always on, and with an Apple Watch connected, a BT speed sensor, BT cadence sensor, and a dongle converting and broadcasting the Apple Watch HR data to BT HRP.  If I had a power sensor it would display date from that as well (I don‚Äôt, but I‚Äôm looking at them on eBay which is a bad sign that I will sooner or later).  I understand that it also works with e-bikes, but I can‚Äôt speak to that. It has its strengths and weaknesses, but its strengths are so strong that they far outweigh its shortcomings.  It‚Äôs silly to use a dedicated head (that costs $$$) and is heavy, when you have your phone with you anyway and This is a really good app for that.
author: Curtis Gray 34

content: It has happened three times already during long rides, the app will crash when you switch off the display or switch to a different app. When you look at the etube ride app again it restarts and gives a message that the ride was corrupted and therefore deleted...completely unacceptable it should not crash and if it does it should restart the cached ride. Also, it needs to integrate to other services especially now that strava is shutting down their API access you need the ability to send to training peaks and other apps as well.
author: Scipio05

content: Generally it‚Äôs pretty good/I don‚Äôt have a ton of complaints. It would be nice if it auto connected to the bike, but the 3 seconds it takes me to hit the Bluetooth button isn‚Äôt a big deal/I‚Äôve gotten used to it. The one thing I really wish it had is cumulative stats, both by month and by year. I do a lot of mutisport racing and this is the only app i use that is 100% dedicated to cycling. While I can do it manually, it would be super useful for gaging mileage, particularly for determining things like how many miles are on the tires.

author: Roxanneolson

content:
The new update released today has a major IOS flaw. After opening the app, if you inadvertently touch and drag the screen even slightly, the app prematurely closes, not just minimized. 

Any properly written IOS app should only close if dragged from the bottom of screen and upward to the screen top. This flaw also makes it impossible to open other apps on the iPhone without risking prematurely closing the Shimano app. 

I enjoyed using the previous version of this app, but this new version is frustrating. Please fix the app asap to confirm with standard IOS swiping motions.
author: kbpaulson

content: It displays a GPS map and my speed and keeps track of where I've gone and how fast I rode my bike. For free, I'm not complaining.
author: dontlikeadstoo

content: Does what it does well, but i feel its missing a few valuable technical display options: a graph, while i ride, showing how many watts i am cranking over the last minute or so; and a similar graph showing motor total output and if it was limited by watts, or torque, or speed. And in ride log, same graphs over the whole ride. It would also be nice to get my total watt minutes for a logged ride, and watt minutes accumulated so far in the ride, and so on. And NUMBERS please, not unscaled graphs and 1..100%! For bonus points, show battery remaining change in watt hours, so i can estimate my situation based on what i know is ahead in the terrain.
